column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=So far the application of adhesive varnishes results in the highest adhesive power; it is possible to use adhesive varnishes with nearly all compound materials.
#Text=The mainly used adhesives are heat-reactive and dissolved in organic solvents.
#Text=The average consumption of adhesives is 12 g/m.sup.2, the quantity of solids being 4 g/m.sup.2 and the quantity of solvents being 8 g/m.sup.2.
#Text=These solvents must be evaporated by application of process heat.
#Text=In addition, they must be removed from the waste air for reasons of air pollution control.
#Text=Regarding the high energy consumption, the problems of air pollution, and the resulting higher costs of investment and operation, this method is very disadvantageous.
#Text=As for the adherency properties which can be achieved the reactive adhesives correspond to the adhesive varnishes, approximately.
#Text=At present, however, the universal application of such reactive adhesives is not yet possible as the methods are still in the phase of development and introduction.
#Text=The reactive adhesives are applied without using solvents and less than 2 g/m.sup.2 is needed.
#Text=Hereby the air pollution problems are solved and the energy consumption is largely reduced.
#Text=The treatment of foils surfaces with a corona discharge, i.e., a high frequency gas discharge under atmospheric pressure, is known from U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=After the treatment the surfaces are bonded together.
#Text=The adhesive power of such a compound foil is, however, not completely satisfying and only a few sorts of foils can be used with this method.
#Text=The corona treatment of metallic foils such as aluminum foils is known from DAS No. 1,222,241; DAS No. 1,236,904; and DAS No. 1,241,682.

#Text=The metallic surfaces treated in order to improve the adherency are subsequently either varnished, or laminated by means of adhesives, or extrusion-coated with synthetic materials such as polyethylene.
#Text=The corona treatment of non-conductive synthetic foils for the same purpose is also well known.

#Text=A survey of the potential fields of application of the electric treatment of materials and surfaces is given in the article "Prospects for industrial applications of electrical discharge", Chem.
#Text=Tech., April 1971, p. 232-237.

#Text=This article gives, among others, a description of the above mentioned discharge treatment of plastic foils in order to improve the adherency while the foils are extrusion-coated with thin synthetic layers of polyethylene, e.g.
#Text=This extrusion coating method with corona treatment already does not use any additional adhesives nor coupling agents.
#Text=On the contrary, the molten synthetic layer acts as if it were an adhesive itself.
